content:
• Thursday, March 14, 2013
  • ULTA

    More on Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q4 handily beats across the board on a 30% rise in total...

    More on Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q4 handily beats across the board on a 30% rise in total revenue. Net profit rose 39% on strong sales gains from its new and existing stores. Its Q1 forecast falls short of Street expectations however, now expecting its EPS in a range of $0.60 to $0.63 on revenue of $568M to $577M. Consensus EPS estimates are for $0.72 on revenue of $580M. Shares are -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (NASDAQ:GLDD): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on revenue but coming up...

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (NASDAQ:GLDD): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on revenue but coming up far short on a per share basis. Additionally, the company is restating Q2 and Q3 results after finding instances in its demolition segment where revenue was incorrectly recognized for those periods. The dredging services provider also says its President and Chief Operating Officer, Bruce Biemeck, has left the company. Biemeck had served as the company's CFO until August. Shares -30% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, 42.8% increase...

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, 42.8% increase from prior dividend of $0.14. Forward yield 1.87%. The board approved share repurchase program of $2.4B, replacing the prior $2B plan, under which $600M are pending. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (NYSE:CPE): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $28.7M misses by...

    Callon Petroleum (NYSE:CPE): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $28.7M misses by $3.22M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • MUX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MUX +4%. BAC +4%. DFS +3%. RRD +2%. MS +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MUX +4%. BAC +4%. DFS +3%. RRD +2%. MS +2%.
    After-hours top losers: GLDD -31%. ULTA -11%. MWA -9%. KKD -6%. ARO -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM | 6 Comments
  • ARO

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 beats on all counts despite a slight decline in total sales...

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 beats on all counts despite a slight decline in total sales Y/Y. Net profit swung to a loss as the apparel retailer racked up higher impairment charges and weaker sales during its critcial holiday selling season. The company also issued Q1 guidance sharply below Street expectations, projecting a quarterly loss of $0.15 - $0.20 per share, while analysts had predicted a profit of $0.08. The company blames the weak guidance on margin pressures from holiday carryover inventory, plus the impact of a weak macroeconomic environment. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • COF

    After hours movers in the regional banks: COF +0.6%, FITB +0.9%, KEY - which just announced an...

    After hours movers in the regional banks: COF +0.6%, FITB +0.9%, KEY - which just announced an increase in the dividend to $0.055 from $0.05 and $426M in share repurchases - up 1%, PNC +0.4%, RF +1.6%, STI -0.3%, USB +0.2%. BBT - whose plan was rejected - off 2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • JPM

    After hours movers in the banks: JPM -2.5% and GS -2.1% after the two had their capital...

    After hours movers in the banks: JPM -2.5% and GS -2.1% after the two had their capital proposals approved but were asked to submit new plans "to address weakness in their capital planning processes." WFC +0.4%, BAC +3.8% after no dividend hike, but a whopping $10.5B in share repurchases and redemption of high-yielding preferreds. Morgan Stanley +0.9%. The XLF +0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 18 Comments
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge (NASDAQ:GLDD): Q4 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $207.1M beats by...

    Great Lakes Dredge (NASDAQ:GLDD): Q4 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $207.1M beats by $13.8M. Shares -32.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • AXP

    More on bank capital return plans: American Express (NYSE:AXP) an increase in the quarterly...

    More on bank capital return plans: American Express (NYSE:AXP) an increase in the quarterly dividend to $0.23 from $0.20 and $4.2B in share repurchases over the next year. BNY Mellon (NYSE:BK) an increase in the quarterly dividend to $0.15 from $0.13 and $1.35B in share repurchases over the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q4 EPS of $0.74. Revenue of $224.4M (+22.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.03M. Shares...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q4 EPS of $0.74. Revenue of $224.4M (+22.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.03M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • COSI

    Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $22.6M misses by $1.11M. Shares...

    Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $22.6M misses by $1.11M. Shares -6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    More on Molycorp's (MCP) Q4 results: Revenues rose 1.1% Y/Y to $134M vs. $161M analyst...

    More on Molycorp's (MCP) Q4 results: Revenues rose 1.1% Y/Y to $134M vs. $161M analyst consensus. Sees H1 financial performance slightly weaker than H2 2012, but expects global supply and demand for rare earth oxides will approach a healthier balance during 2013, and pricing within many key applications of rare earths will be beneficial to both customers and suppliers. MCP +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • STEC

    More on STEC: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $21M-$23M and EPS of -$0.40 to -$0.42, below a...

    More on STEC: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $21M-$23M and EPS of -$0.40 to -$0.42, below a consensus of $38.8M and -$0.32. CEO Mark Moshayedi suggests STEC's ongoing transition away from OEM sales (sales to EMC have plunged) is responsible for the near-term weakness. An unnamed non-OEM customer accounted for over 10% of 2H sales. Q4 gross margin was 32.8%, -470 bps Q/Q and -870 bps Y/Y. Opex rose 20% Y/Y even as revenue fell 40%. STEC -10.8% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $797.7M (-1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $797.7M (-1% Y/Y) beats by $18.04M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • STEC

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q4 EPS of -$0.35 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $35.1M misses by $2.64M. Shares...

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q4 EPS of -$0.35 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $35.1M misses by $2.64M. Shares -12.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q4 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $118.1M beats by $2.17M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)

    Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q4 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $118.1M beats by $2.17M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • BB

    Bullish notes from Goldman's Simona Jankowski and Jefferies' Peter Misek didn't stop BlackBerry...

    Bullish notes from Goldman's Simona Jankowski and Jefferies' Peter Misek didn't stop BlackBerry (BBRY -3.8%) from giving back some of yesterday's gains. Jankowski sees 2M-3M BB10 shipments apiece for the May-November quarters, and says Z10 checks at nearly 40 stores in 4 countries indicate "most stores had a successful launch week, followed by steady demand." Misek says his checks indicate build orders have been raised 3 times in 6 weeks, and speculates the 1M-unit order likely came from a U.S. carrier or a top distributor (Ingram Micro/Brightstar).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 19 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q4 EPS of $1.00 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $758.8M (+30.3% Y/Y) beats...

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q4 EPS of $1.00 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $758.8M (+30.3% Y/Y) beats by $4.87M. Shares -11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP): Q4 EPS of -$0.45 misses by $0.15. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)

    Molycorp (MCP): Q4 EPS of -$0.45 misses by $0.15. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (RBCN +4.9%) closes with a decent gain on a day when it released its 2012 10-K. The...

    Rubicon (RBCN +4.9%) closes with a decent gain on a day when it released its 2012 10-K. The hard-luck LED sapphire wafer maker, which has hammered last month after providing light guidance to go with a small Q4 miss, had 26.2% of its float shorted as of Feb. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -29.7%) has lost its infringement suit against Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO), as the jury...

    VirnetX (VHC -29.7%) has lost its infringement suit against Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO), as the jury deliberating over the suit rules against the company. VirnetX, which had been seeking $258M in damages for infringement of its VPN IP, is likely to appeal. Shares are cratering in the meantime. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • OREX

    Shares of Orexigen (OREX -4.8%) slip deeper into the red today after it reported a Q4 that beat...

    Shares of Orexigen (OREX -4.8%) slip deeper into the red today after it reported a Q4 that beat on a per share basis, but came up short on revenue. The company reported a loss of $0.41 per share, versus the consensus of a $0.44 per share loss. Revenues were $857K, below analyst estimates of $890K. Total operating expenses were significantly higher for the quarter, coming in at $33.3M compared to $5.2M in Q411, reflecting higher R&D expenses associated with the conduct of its Contrave cardiovascular outcomes trial. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    Bank of America Merrill Lynch is apparently coming to the defense of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG...

    Bank of America Merrill Lynch is apparently coming to the defense of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -3.4%), saying its surprised by the selloff, because ACOG's post fundamentally isn't any different from previous articles already posted by JAMA. Citron also made cautious comments on the stock earlier this month based on the same topic as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU +2.5%) moves higher after the company posts a note on its Facebook page...

    Lululemon (LULU +2.5%) moves higher after the company posts a note on its Facebook page indicating it will be closing an outlet store in Canada as the retailer looks to focus on outlet locations outside of major urban areas. Look for the company to have more to say on the issue when it reports earnings on March 21.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -2.7%) takes a hit on comments posted by American Congress of OB/GYN...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -2.7%) takes a hit on comments posted by American Congress of OB/GYN president James T. Breeden, MD, saying that he doesn't see robotic surgery as the most cost-efficient procedure for hysterectomies, and that expensive technology for routine surgical care does not improve patient outcomes. Consequently, there is no good data proving that robotic hysterectomy is even as good as — let alone better— than existing, and far less costly, minimally invasive alternatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • LYB

    Deutsche Bank is out with some posititve comments on LyondellBasell Industries (LYB +2.7%)...

    Deutsche Bank is out with some posititve comments on LyondellBasell Industries (LYB +2.7%) today, raising its price target to $75 from $70 and reiterating its Buy rating on the back of its investor meeting. Deutsche's David Begleiter noted that LYB's investor meeting exceeded expectations as management increased its EBITDA target in 2016 from new capacity/improvement projects to $1.6 - $2.0B from $1B previously, and he's confident the company can earn $10 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -4.7%) co-founder/CTO Charles Hull sold 500K shares on March 13. That leaves...

    3D Systems (DDD -4.7%) co-founder/CTO Charles Hull sold 500K shares on March 13. That leaves Hull, 73, with only 461.5K shares in the company. 3D shares appear to be pressured by the news. (13D filings: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 32 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.2%) shares touch yet another multiyear low of $21.35, as the...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.2%) shares touch yet another multiyear low of $21.35, as the company continues to reel from negative news during the week. Analysts at BAML cut their 2013 earnings outlook for CLF to breakeven vs. $0.05/share profit following the decision to idle its Wabush Pointe Noire pellet plant in Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT -15.4%) can't catch a break; shares are now down 34% since the mobile ad agency...

    Velti (VELT -15.4%) can't catch a break; shares are now down 34% since the mobile ad agency badly missed Q4 estimates and issued light guidance. Jefferies' Peter Misek, who cut shares to Hold in response, notes Velti has violated its debt covenants and thinks "going concern" issues now exist. Janney's Richard Fetyko considers it hard to determine how much of Velti's revenue comes from paying customers in light of its collection issues, and observes the company had $56M in cash and $47M in debt as of early Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • CVLT

    M&A speculation has led CommVault (CVLT +8%) to surge to new all-time highs. CommVault's...

    M&A speculation has led CommVault (CVLT +8%) to surge to new all-time highs. CommVault's above-market growth and strong positioning in the high-end storage backup/recovery software market could appeal to a larger enterprise IT firm, but the company sports a market cap of $3.9B and trades at a lofty 54x estimated FY14 (ends March '14) EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • AAV-OLD

    Advantage Oil & Gas (AAV-OLD +5.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus...

    Advantage Oil &Gas (AAV-OLD +5.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus after AAV announced large positive revisions to historical reserves, sparking a new two-year plan focused on doubling production throughput at Glacier to 200M cf/day by 2015. A series of positive well results revealed improved average test rates in the Middle Montney.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • VHC

    The jury handling VirnetX's (VHC -12.3%) infringement suit against Cisco has failed to reach a...

    The jury handling VirnetX's (VHC -12.3%) infringement suit against Cisco has failed to reach a unanimous verdict, and has been ordered to continue deliberations. VirnetX shares have dived over the last 30 minutes on the news, but have rebounded some from their lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • ORAN

    European carriers rally as continental equities move higher and an EU summit in which budget...

    European carriers rally as continental equities move higher and an EU summit in which budget rules are taking center stage gets underway. FTE +6.1%. TEF +3.8%. TI +5.2%. VOD +2%. BT +5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • DRQ

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +1.5%) is awarded a contract to supply drilling and production equipment for the...

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +1.5%) is awarded a contract to supply drilling and production equipment for the Shell Malikai project located offshore Malaysia, a pleasant surprise for Wells Fargo, which says DRQ scored a larger than expected share of the total accessible market. The firm estimates DRQ's revenue from the project will reach as high as $130M, far below its assumption of $35M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • MGM

    Shares of MGM Resorts (MGM +6.9%) race higher after Tracinda Corp. discloses that it may...

    Shares of MGM Resorts (MGM +6.9%) race higher after Tracinda Corp. discloses that it may increase its stake in the casino operator. The Kirk Kerkorian investment vehicle already holds 18.6% of outstanding MGM shares. (13D)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (AVG +6%) sees a healthy bounce after BWS Financial launches coverage with a...

    AVG Technologies (AVG +6%) sees a healthy bounce after BWS Financial launches coverage with a Buy and $30 PT. The firm declares recent worries about Google's search toolbar policy changes overdone. "The search toolbar is a secondary product for AVG and not the source of what has given the Company 146 million users." It thinks the platform business (toolbar monetization) is now being assigned "zero valuation" by the Street, even though it isn't going away.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +1.2%) says that Chief Financial Officer Robert Hagemann is stepping down...

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +1.2%) says that Chief Financial Officer Robert Hagemann is stepping down after 21 years at the company, effective May 31. The medical lab-testing firm has launched a search to find a successor, and will consider both internal and external candidates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • CNW

    Con-Way (CNW +1.5%) shrugs off a valuation downgrade to Neutral at Goldman Sachs to trade...

    Con-Way (CNW +1.5%) shrugs off a valuation downgrade to Neutral at Goldman Sachs to trade higher, after Deutsche Bank added the shares to its Short-Term Buy List. Deutsche cites a number of catlysts for the upgrade, including a better housing market and improved manufacturing metrics. Longer-term they see earnings power of $4, which could push the stock to $60 based on a 15x P/E multiple - 68% upside form current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • WPX

    Rising natural gas prices and lower inventories boost shares of gas-focused firms, including...

    Rising natural gas prices and lower inventories boost shares of gas-focused firms, including WPXEnergy (WPX +5.2%), the S&P's top performer. But Susquehanna warns of unwarranted optimism in WPX, seeing "weak execution going forward reflecting a lower than peer average capacity to reinvest and lack of visible scale of reinvention target." Also: CHK +2.8%, NBL +3.2%, COG +2.6%, LNG +5%, KWK +17.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • PLCM

    Leon Cooperman's Omega Advisors has raised its stake in Polycom (PLCM +4.2%) to 5.4% - up 70%...

    Leon Cooperman's Omega Advisors has raised its stake in Polycom (PLCM +4.2%) to 5.4% - up 70% since the end of Q4. That's providing a nice lift to shares of the struggling videoconferencing hardware provider.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • VMW

    An upgrade to Outerpform from RBC helps VMware (VMW +3%) add to the big gains it saw yesterday...

    An upgrade to Outerpform from RBC helps VMware (VMW +3%) add to the big gains it saw yesterday thanks to its strong growth outlook and the Pivotal announcement. "A path to accelerating revenues and margin expansion was outlined [at EMC/VMware's investor day], something we had wanted to see before becoming more aggressive on the stock.," writes analyst Matthew Hedberg. Parent EMC (EMC +2%) is also trekking higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • SD

    Changes made at SandRidge (SD -2.7%) add uncertainty to a company with no near-term growth...

    Changes made at SandRidge (SD -2.7%) add uncertainty to a company with no near-term growth catalysts and a weak asset base, analysts say. UBS expects SD to "materially underperform” on production and growth; CapitalOne points out that even after any asset sales, SD will still be left with deteriorating Mississippi Lime properties and Gulf of Mexico assets “with minimal large-scale exploration well potential.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 18 Comments
  • TENX

    Shares of Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT +2.5%) gains after the company announced late Wednesday...

    Shares of Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT +2.5%) gains after the company announced late Wednesday it would release FQ3 earnings on March 19 and hold a shareholder meeting on April 26.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • EBAY

    More on Evercore's upgrade of eBay (EBAY +3.4%): Analyst Ken Sena forecasts 2013 revenue of...

    More on Evercore's upgrade of eBay (EBAY +3.4%): Analyst Ken Sena forecasts 2013 revenue of $16.6B and EPS of $2.88, above a consensus of $16.35B and $2.75. He downplays comments made yesterday by MasterCard exec Chris McWilton about fee increases for PayPal, which took a toll on eBay shares yesterday. Sena thinks even a 50% fee increase will yield less than a 50 bps margin impact. Separately, PayPal has rolled out an iPad register app to take on the increasingly popular Square Register; it's the online payments giant's first native iPad app.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • SBOW

    Swift Energy (SFY +6%) says its horizontal Eagle Ford wells have demonstrated stronger initial...

    Swift Energy (SFY +6%) says its horizontal Eagle Ford wells have demonstrated stronger initial production rates and have caused it to increase the estimated ultimate recoveries associated with them. Six operated wells have been completed so far in the current quarter. (PR; slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • LDK

    No mercy is shown to LDK Solar (LDK -12.2%) as expectations grow a Suntech default and/or...

    No mercy is shown to LDK Solar (LDK -12.2%) as expectations grow a Suntech default and/or bankruptcy filing is on tap. Shares are now down 23% over the last 2 days. LDK had $3.1B in debt on its balance sheet as of Sep. 30, has been steadily bleeding cash, and ended Q3 with just $442M in cash/equivalents and short-term pledged bank deposits. The company has been scrambling to shore up its finances.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • CERS

    Cerus (CERS +2.9%) pushes nearer to its 52-week high after the company prices its secondary...

    Cerus (CERS +2.9%) pushes nearer to its 52-week high after the company prices its secondary offering of around 8.3M shares at $4.20 each, a 5% discount to yesterday's close. The proceeds from the $35M offering, announced yesterday, will be used to fund the research and marketing of its Intercept Blood System, as well as for various other corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • CNC

    Medicaid insurer Centene (CNC -1.2%) slips after JPMorgan cut the shares to Neutral, citing...

    Medicaid insurer Centene (CNC -1.2%) slips after JPMorgan cut the shares to Neutral, citing concerns over the impact of the health-care overhaul on the managed-care sector. The firm says that Medicaid expansion offers growth opportunities for companies like CNC, but its scope remains in doubt. Its estimates now discount new membership for seven of the company's 16 states, where opposition from lawmakers is making expansion uncertain.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • RGR

    The Senate Judiciary Committee approves a ban on assault weapons and high-capacity ammunition...

    The Senate Judiciary Committee approves a ban on assault weapons and high-capacity ammunition clips with the votes coming down the party line 10 to 8. Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR -1.9%) and Smith & Wesson (SWHC -1.4%) both trade lower for the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 4 Comments
  • SD

    UNG +2.3% following an unexpected drawdown in natural gas storage. The news isn't helping...

    UNG +2.3% following an unexpected drawdown in natural gas storage. The news isn't helping SandRidge (SD -3%) as investors "sell the news" of TPG winning its battle against CEO Tom Ward and the board.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 9 Comments
  • GERN

    Shares of Geron (GERN -6.1%) get slammed today, despite posting a solid Q4 report after...

    Shares of Geron (GERN -6.1%) get slammed today, despite posting a solid Q4 report after yesterday's close. Revenues soared by nearly 175% from the prior year period, easily topping consensus estimates. However, concerns over an ongoing investigation into lab value abnormalities from its essential thrombocythemia study, plus opaque visibility on imetelstat progress have prompted a number of firms to cut their ratings. Piper Jaffray downgraded the shares to Overweight, while mid-day yesterday Stifel Nicolaus went even further, cutting the shares to sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • STP

    Suntech’s (STP -35.8%) troubles come even as the NYT reports U.S. solar installations...

    Suntech’s (STP -35.8%) troubles come even as the NYT reports U.S. solar installations surged to a record in 2012, in part because of the same oversupply of cheap Chinese solar panels that have crushed prices and solar stocks. Perhaps that’s why even as Suntech shares collapse, the solar sector (TAN +0.5%) is holding up well so far; YGE flat, FSLR -0.6%, TSL -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ETFC

    More on E*Trade (ETFC -5.8%): Not only is 10% of the float a lot to throw on the market, but...

    More on E*Trade (ETFC -5.8%): Not only is 10% of the float a lot to throw on the market, but Citadel's exit from the remainder of its stake means the chance for a sale of the company has likely disappeared. Ken Griffin cut his stake to below 10% 2 years ago just to he could actively agitate for a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -31%) won't be bailed out by a Chinese government that wants to make good on its...

    Suntech (STP -31%) won't be bailed out by a Chinese government that wants to make good on its promise to let individual firms sink or swim, claim two advisers to national agencies. The NYT reported yesterday the Wuxi municipal government had reached a deal with Suntech. Maxim Group thinks a default could arrive tomorrow, and that most of fraud-wracked GSF Capital's 141MW project pipeline can't be sold; many on the Street seem to believe them.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ +3.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, which...

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ +3.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, which says the improvement in heavy oil differentials and strong Horizon production volumes YTD are not reflected in the stock and should allow for a strong Q1.
